Texto: 
va: 20/20 od, 20/40 os
visual field: wnl confrontation
eom: wnl
no rapd

conjunctiva: not injected
ant chamber: mass - black, superior, pedunculated, draped over pupil,  mid-iris
black pigment on iris

inferior  cornea: pigment patches
gonio: increased angle pigment, especially inferiorly

no vessels on mass
mass abuted cornea
indentations of surface
iop = 12 ou
normal pachymetry
surgery:
iridocyclectomy
os
excision
specimen
to utsw

gross pathology:
 - iris tissue
 - 2 black fragments
 - 7 x 5 x 3 mm aggregate
 - inked red
 - larger fragment bisected
 - submitted entirely
ultrasound:
ubm 
 - solid lesion
 - no sign internal vascularity
 - no cystic component
 - no posterior iris enlargement
melanocytoma of the iris in a child
12 y.o. hispanic girl
no abnormal pigmentation
intermittent pain os for 6 weeks
remote h/o trauma os 6 years previously
in no distress until onset of pain
no ocular redness
no ocular discharge
no acuity complaints
when she c/o pain
parent noted iris os “had changed”
when iris changed?
unclear if prior to pain onset
pmh and ros
non-contributory
no abnormal clotting
no recurrent infection hx
unusual features of this melanocytoma case:
 - patient age
 - patient race
 - clinical presentation
 - extent of cd68 staining
 - large size of melanin granules
